summary: This FBI Significant Case Notification from June 28, 2019, details the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein for sex trafficking of minors, initiated in December 2018. It summarizes the background of the case from 2005, the 2007 non-prosecution agreement, and recent developments including a planned sealed indictment and arrest. The document outlines Epstein's abuse of minors in New York and Florida, his recruitment methods, and upcoming investigative plans including asset seizure and victim interviews.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the FBI investigation for sexually abusing and sex trafficking minors in New York and Florida from the mid-2000s onward. The document details his methods of abuse, recruitment, and his 2008 plea deal.

persons.name: Ut SSA
persons.context: Listed as the CID (Criminal Investigative Division) Point of Contact for the Epstein case in this notification.

persons.name: SSA
persons.context: Listed as the Field Point of Contact for the Epstein case in this notification. Likely a different SSA than 'Ut SSA'.

persons.name: CMB
persons.context: Appears at the bottom of the document as the approving official for the notification.

connections.description: Epstein and his co-conspirators were offered a non-prosecution agreement in 2007 and worked together to recruit and traffic minor girls for sexual acts.
Epstein sexually abused dozens of minor girls, paying them $200-$1000 after sexualized massages, and coerced some victims to recruit others.
Epstein had assistants in New York and Florida who contacted minors via telephone to arrange appointments for 'massages' at his residences.

events.title: Initial Abuse Period in Florida
events.description: Epstein sexually abused a victim, leading her parents to report to law enforcement in 2005, which initiated the first investigation.

events.title: Initiation of First Investigation
events.description: West Palm Beach Police Department and FBI Miami initiated an investigation after parents reported Epstein's abuse of their daughter. The investigation included interviews with ~35 victims and execution of a search warrant.

events.title: Non-Prosecution Agreement Offered
events.description: After Epstein's attorneys met with the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Florida, Epstein and his co-conspirators were offered a non-prosecution agreement.

events.title: Epstein's Florida State Guilty Plea
events.description: As part of the non-prosecution agreement, Epstein pleaded guilty in Florida state court to soliciting prostitution.

events.title: Epstein's Jail Sentence
events.description: Epstein was sentenced to 18 months in jail, served approximately 13 months in a facility that allowed daytime work release.

events.title: FBI NY Case Initiation
events.description: FBI NY initiated a case after the Southern District of New York (SDNY) contacted them regarding several victims sexually abused by Epstein in the mid-2000s.

events.title: Planned Sealed Indictment
events.description: SDNY tentatively planned to charge Epstein under a sealed indictment for sex trafficking of children and conspiracy to engage in human trafficking.

events.title: Planned Arrest and Asset Seizure
events.description: Plans were made to arrest Epstein and file a lis pendens on his Manhattan residence as an initial step toward seizure, coordinated with a press conference and tip line announcement.

locations: New York City, New York (location of Epstein's modeling agency investment and professional activities)
Southern District of New York (SDNY) - jurisdiction
keyFacts: The FBI NY case was initiated on December 6, 2018, based on information from SDNY regarding multiple victims sexually abused by Jeffrey Epstein in the mid-2000s.

A 2007 non-prosecution agreement, involving the then-U.S. Attorney for SDFL (later the U.S. Secretary of Labor), allowed Epstein to plead guilty in 2008 to state solicitation charges, serving only ~13 months of an 18-month sentence with work release.
Epstein's abuse pattern involved paying minors $200-$1000 for 'massages' that turned sexual, and he specifically sought girls who looked under 18, knowing some were as young as 14.

SDNY planned to charge Epstein in July 2019 under a sealed indictment for sex trafficking of children and conspiracy, with coordinated plans for his arrest and seizure of his properties valued at ~$100M.
Epstein and his co-conspirators used assistants to contact minors and coerced some victims to recruit other underage girls, maintaining a steady stream for sexual acts at his multiple residences.
